result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by Wednesday, October 15, 2015 at 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must obtain and maintain fulltime employment. Must seek work if unemployed and apply at at least 5 places per week and submit those applications to the probation agent.

Must have no contact with Travis Prill or Angela Jackson or any other persons who are using or dealing controlled substances.   Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: 3 days credit towards conditional jail sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon J Lewis in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:44 Court relates and gives appearances.
3:44  State gives recommendation.
3:45  Atty. Hinde relates.  
PSI is waived by State and Defense.  Court approves waiver.
3:51  Court relates and questions defendant.
4:03  Brandon Lewis makes statement.
4:45  Atty. Hinde makes argument.
4:11  Court relates.

Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #5:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.

SW
1 year probation (by Wed; 10/15/15 at 3:00 PM)
AODA and follow through with treatment
Comply with any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO.
Pay court costs (to be paid over term of probation)
No contact with Travis Prill or Angela Jackson or any other prersons who are using or dealing controllecd substances.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment
Seek work if unemployed (apply at at least 5 places per week and submit those applications to PO)
Submit DNA sample and pay its surcharge (provide within 2 weeks)
3 days jail with credit for 3 days already served.

Defendant Brandon J Lewis in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Formal reading of information filed. Defendant stands mute. Court enters not guilty pleas on his behalf.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

COVERS:
15CF314: Defendant Angela L Jackson in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Russell Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF315: Defendant Brandon J Lewis in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Russell Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF316: Defendant Travis L Prill in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant Prill in custody.  Russell Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Krave requests cash bond be modified to signature bond.  Argument by State.  Court denies modification of bond.

3:08 Officer Jon Fick, Chetek Police Department called, sworn and direct by State.  Witness identifies defendants Brandon J Lewis, Travis Prill, and Angela L Jackson.
3:18 Cross by Attorney Hinde.
3:23 Cross by Attorney Krave.
3:26 Cross by Attorney Hoel.
3:29 Re-direct by State and re-cross by Attorney Hinde.

State requests Judicial Notice of WI Circuit Access information from Chippewa County Case 15CF226 attached to Complaint for Travis Prill. Court takes Judicial Notice.
Court also takes Judicial Notice that all defendants had previous bond orders to not commit any further crimes. 

Argument by State.  No argument by Attorney Hinde.  Argument by Attorney Krave. No argument by Attorney Hoel. 
Court finds probable cause and binds each of the defendants over.

All cases Arraignment scheduled for 09/02/2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Brandon J Lewis in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Brandon J Lewis in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
